channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Forest blocking pavement and step down kerb. Vicarage Grove, 20th December
item.description:
This has been reoccurring this week. Please ask your selfish customers to park with thought and sensitivity for example by leaving their Lime / forest bike across the road where there is plenty of space to park without compromising pedestrians . This has been happening for years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 20th December
item.description:
Flytipping of umbrella and other things. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): William Barefoot Drive, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Access issue - drop down curb required, 20th December
item.description:
Can a drop down curb be installed here, between footpath from the main roundabout footpath to next to where cafe has chairs with barriers to prevent cars parking there? Cannot traverse whilst in wheelchair, is dangerous as because of high curb wheelchair users are forced tpcross via entrance to side access road, cars park there blocking access, cars reverse out. The drop down curb already there forces pedestrians to walk behind parked cars. Wheelchair users are more vulnerable, drivers cut across or reverse out. Access needs to be made wheelchair friendly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree uprooted, 20th December
item.description:
Tree uprooted - probably vandalism - may be able to save the tree if replanted and protected. Also for months now, significant amount of tree cuttings dumped on the green space. When grass was cut by the Council, they just skirted round the cuttings rather than removing them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paxton Road, Plaistow, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emerson Street, Southwark, Greater London

item.title: Dog owners using playground as dog toilet, 20th December
item.description:
The amount of dog poo in the playground between Eynsford House, Hever House, and Lamberhurst House is out of hand. This used to be a minor issue but lately it seems lots of dog owners now think it’s acceptable to use the playground that my 3 year old son likes to play in as their convenient dog toilet. There is a sign inside the playground indicating dogs aren’t allowed but no one pays attention to that.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovelinch Close, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
